symbolsArray.name: Exclamation Mark
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to express strong emotion or surprise.

symbolsArray.name: At Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to indicate an email address or to mention someone on social media.

symbolsArray.name: Hash/Pound Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used for various purposes, such as denoting numbers, hashtags, or comments in programming languages.

symbolsArray.name: Dollar Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to represent currency, particularly the US dollar.

symbolsArray.name: Percent Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to indicate a proportion or percentage.

symbolsArray.name: Ampersand
symbolsArray.description: A logogram representing the word 'and'.

symbolsArray.name: Asterisk
symbolsArray.description: A typographic symbol used for various purposes, such as indicating footnotes or multiplication.

symbolsArray.name: Underscore
symbolsArray.description: A horizontal line used to separate words or as a special character in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Plus Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used for addition or to indicate positive quantities.

symbolsArray.name: Minus Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used for subtraction or to indicate negative quantities.

symbolsArray.name: Equal Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to indicate equality or assignment in programming languages.

symbolsArray.name: Less Than Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to indicate that one value is less than another.

symbolsArray.name: Greater Than Sign
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to indicate that one value is greater than another.

symbolsArray.name: Left Parenthesis
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to enclose or group parts of an expression in mathematics or programming.

symbolsArray.name: Right Parenthesis
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to close or mark the end of a group in mathematics or programming.

symbolsArray.name: Left Square Bracket
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to enclose an array or to indicate indexing in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Right Square Bracket
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to close an array or mark the end of indexing in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Left Curly Brace
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to enclose a block of code or to denote objects in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Right Curly Brace
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to close a block of code or mark the end of an object in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Vertical Bar/Pipe
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to represent logical OR or bitwise OR operations in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Backslash
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used to escape special characters or represent directory paths in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Forward Slash
symbolsArray.description: A symbol used as a separator in file paths or to denote division in mathematics.

symbolsArray.name: Double Quote
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to indicate the start or end of a string.

symbolsArray.name: Single Quote
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to indicate the start or end of a character or string literal.

symbolsArray.name: Colon
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to introduce a list or to denote a ratio or time.

symbolsArray.name: Semicolon
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to separate elements in a list or to terminate a statement in programming.

symbolsArray.name: Comma
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to separate items in a list or to indicate a pause in a sentence.

symbolsArray.name: Period
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to indicate the end of a sentence or as a decimal separator.

symbolsArray.name: Question Mark
symbolsArray.description: A punctuation mark used to indicate a question or to express doubt or uncertainty.
